items.content: The first thing you should to do before starting tranlsating is to ask in the Discord chats #Feedback or #support if the language you want to translate is already being translated. (link to Discord below)

If the answer is no, you can start translating.
You have 2 ways to translate.
You can use a .json editing program or the tool on the offical Assistant for No Man's Sky website. (Link to website and tool below).

sections.heading: Lets get started with the translation tool

items.content:
When you open the website, you will see that there are 2 ways you can start translating.

The first way is by just choosing the language you want to tranlsate from the dropdown.

The second way is by uploading the .json file by clicking "Drop file here".

I recommend using the first method.

items.name: Offical Assistant for No Man's Sky website

items.content: I will now explain the interface.

"Text to be tranlsated"
This is the text that you have to tranlsate.

"Translation box"
This is the area you can write.

"Download files with translated words"
Downloads the .json file with the translated words.

sections.heading: What to do with the translated words?

items.content: When you finished translating all words, you can send them into the Discord chat #Translation Or directly to the app dev via e-mail. (see below)

sections.heading: What languages are already in the app?

items.content: (The number of supported languages might increase with the time. I am trying to update the list when a new language was added. If you have any questions to the guide please feel free to ask me on Discord)
